website_summaries.verdict: The Canon EOS 77D is a midrange SLR camera that incorporates features from the entry-level Rebel series and the premium 80D.
pros: Dual Pixel AF in Live View

customer_reviews.title: Compact DSLR with super-fast autofocus
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an upgrade to an EOS600D. The major improvements can be summed up as follows - 24 mega pixel vs 18, quicker and vastly more sophisticated autofocus system, rear touch screen, faster sequential photos, built-in stabilisation system for video, included Wifi/Bluetooth (for file transfer, camera control etc), top LCD display. A few 'negatives' - the battery life seems to be shorter, no 4K video. Overall I am very pleased I made the upgrade and believe the money was well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I chose this as an upgrade from my much loved 600d. The image quality is so good and I can still use the same lenses. Still a quality Canon product with the latest version of their processor. Excellent
customer_reviews.author: DPE

customer_reviews.title: Super Camera, what more to say
customer_reviews.text: Super Camera, what more to say. I have not had it long enough to give it a really good review, but so far its brilliant. Mind you, it is a big upgrade from my old canon 1000D (also a great camera in its day).
customer_reviews.author: Allan

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest of cameras
customer_reviews.text: Not as impressed with this as I was expecting. It's a reasonable camera but the build quality is nowhere near as good as my 5 year old canon 700D . And it certainly isn't dust proof. Had to have mine professionally cleaned out within a fortnight of purchasing it (even the viewfinder was full of junk) still not 100% clear now. And I hadn't taken it anywhere dusty at all. The photos are nice and crisp and accurate but the battery dies much quicker than my 700D and my neewer flash has problems connecting.
customer_reviews.author: Karrade

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, versatile camera.
customer_reviews.text: Nice upgrade from my aging 350D, still getting to grips with it but it's got a nice weight and feel to it. Having the quick buttons and wheels makes it so easy to change settings. The mode dial locks unless you press the release, no more finding the dial's been bumped after you've gone to take the picture. Still to find out what the battery life's like and how the low light AF is compared to the old one, plenty more playing to do.
customer_reviews.author: Dunk

customer_reviews.title: Pleased as always
customer_reviews.text: Second Canon Camera. Had 600D before so just doing a refresh. Pleased as always. Technology has moved on in a few years for folks that like to play. But for those that don't and want to point and click of good pics every time. This is a good one. However the "enhanced technology", like iPhone and PC connection is a bit clunky for his day and age (from a man with 34yrs in IT)
customer_reviews.author: JPA

customer_reviews.title: Usual Canon quality
customer_reviews.text: nice consumer level camera with plenty of advanced features, watch out though as lens mount is the cheap plastic type not metal on the kit lens provided. Canon do not make a battery pack for this model either if you want to add a grip you will have to go 3rd party.
customer_reviews.author: mickspix

customer_reviews.title: Fab I love it
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my biggest purchases and I haven’t been disappointed. Only bought the camera last week and still getting to grips with it. So far so good. Easy to use and set up. Really like the autofocus and how the photos transfer from the camera to your iPhone. Seems a genuine camera as registered with canon with no issues. Looking forward to purchasing more lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, packed with features thanks canon
customer_reviews.text: Had a 750d before which was stolen along with other gear. Glad I got it, nice body, feature rich, and while not a full sized sensor camera, not the cheapest camera, but am glad I purchased it
customer_reviews.author: A. P. Suri

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the canon 77d it is a wonderful camera which does everything I need from it, haven't had any issues with it at all. It would be nice if it had a bigger battery but other than that, spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Burton

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with plenty of options
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace my aging 7D.I love this camera as it's like a lightweight enhanced 7D.I haven't had a chance to test it properly but so far it's been superb
customer_reviews.author: Nick Goodyear

customer_reviews.title: Very good budget camera
customer_reviews.text: A perfect camera for starting getting deeper into photography. Nice ergonomics, good picture quality and the kit lens that came with the camera already give a lot of interesting possibilities. It's almost the same hardware as the 80D, but it's way cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Guilherme Lucio

customer_reviews.title: Incredible functionality
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for a previous model. So much more functionality. Great camera but will take some learning.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ray S

customer_reviews.title: Great camera superb value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great camera Robust easy to handle and wonderful picture quality
customer_reviews.author: 2cv fan club

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, perfect for every kind of photo
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying this new camera. Great quality of photos, easy to use, lots to learn and play with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use and good tutorials, I've moved up a gear in photography
customer_reviews.author: Alan M. Clarke

customer_reviews.title: I'm really happy with this camera
customer_reviews.text: Had this camera more than 1 years. Working really good. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Dovile Tugaudyte

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera and lens
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera and lens, Value for money. A little bit heavier than previous camera but given the size and versatility of the lens, acceptable. Good to handle. Excellent screen display. Looking forward to using it in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Arthur D Ward

customer_reviews.title: Buy a screen protector for the touch screen to help thebscreen last longer!
customer_reviews.text: Can't fault it! I have used this at cars and weddings and it keeps up very well! Works perfectly will all my lens old and new!
customer_reviews.author: Spanners

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: Amazing camera! Brilliant in a range of lighting situations, low light, night time and bright daylight. Lightweight, easy to pick up the controls after a few hours
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Raistrick

customer_reviews.title: excelent product
customer_reviews.text: use it every day on my walks with the dog
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great Canon Camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, Does all that I need it to do and WiFi access to photos has been great.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: What are you waiting for, just buy it.!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product at a great price thru a black friday deal. Full of great features and the exposure metering system on this camera is absolutely excellent . Photoshop users be aware that the RAW files produced by this camera require the latest versions of adobe camera raw to be installed which if you have CS6 or earlier will not be available to you. You will therefore need to use Adobe's DNG converter or spend pots of cash on upgrading your Photoshop/Lightroom versions. Really pleased that I purchased this camera only minus point so far is that the body feels rather 'plasticky' when compared to other EOS systems that I've used. Probably add more reviews after a period of serious use.
customer_reviews.author: Stu

customer_reviews.title: ... a 10 year old 40D and was a bit disappointed with it to be honest because the image quality ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for a 10 year old 40D and was a bit disappointed with it to be honest because the image quality wasn't any better and it lost some of the ability of the 40D. Still a good camera and lighter than the 40D so worth it for me in that respect as I was sick of carrying a heavy camera around with me. If it is your first camera then you should love it.
customer_reviews.author: Much Read Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Canon 77D
customer_reviews.text: An excellent camera with many features that would put other more expensive cameras to shame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Canon DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I used this camera while travelling in Italy. The DSLR is full of features, including a flip out display, Wi-fi, Bluetooth, time-lapse mode and more. Most of the photos I have added are using the Canon 24-105 mm full-frame lens. With this body, it's a great setup. Pros Great image and video quality Packed with features Touchscreen display great for viewing images Cons No GPS Value - Canon has only just caught up in adding 60 FPS to their DSLR's No image stabilization (however, does have has digital video stabilization) No environmental sealing Confusing between this model and the Canon 800D Heavier that similar models
customer_reviews.author: Davidson Reviews

product_meta.title: Canon EOS 77D Body Only Digital SLR Camera - Black
product_meta.description: Style Name:Camera Body OnlyRealise your imagination, with a blend of performance and control that puts creativity at your fingertips. • Have the confidence to explore new subjects and new ways of shooting. State-of-the-art 45-point autofocus delivers images that are packed with detail, and the EOS 77D can capture 24.2-megapixel images at a rate of 6 frames per second, helping you catch the briefest moments. • A next-generation 24.2-megapixel sensor produces images that are packed with rich details – ready for editing, cropping or display. Sophisticated exposure metering technology delivers great-looking images straight from the camera, even in complex lighting conditions. The world’s fastest Live View AF¬¬ performance focuses in as little as 0.03 sec, for pin-sharp results. • With the EOS 77D you can be every bit as creative with movies as you can with still photos. Its acclaimed Dual Pixel CMOS AF tracks moving objects without hesitation or distraction, and can smoothly refocus with a single tap of the touch screen, for professional pull-focus like effects. • When you pick up the EOS 77D you’ll notice how its controls fall naturally under your fingers, letting you change settings without taking the camera away from your eye. A Vari-angle touch screen provides smartphone-like navigation, as well as alternative shooting angles. • A combination of Wi-Fi, Bluetooth® and NFC technologies lets you form wireless connections with compatible iOS and Android smart devices more easily than ever, for remote camera control. Using the Canon Camera Connect app, your device can upload images to the cloud for sharing on social networking sites.
feature_bullets: Realise your potential as a photographer
Take more control as your photographic style develops.Camera EOS 77D bodyEyecup EFCamera Cover R-F-3Wide Strap EW-100DBVBattery Charger LC-E17EBattery Pack LP-E17Power CableUser Manual Kit
